item.title: Functions
item.description: A function is a block of code that’s named, you can use that name or a variable that points to that function. If you’re not writing the code inside a function, then you’re writing the code inside the global scope, which is pretty limited. Most of the code that you write, you’d want them to be reusable within functions. Function Basics> Function Basics # One way to look at functions is that a function is a block of code with a name and because it has a name you can call it over and over.

item.title: Program Flow
